title: How to Make a Space Heater with Flower Pots and Candles

steps.headline: Drill a 5/8” hole on the base of the flower pot using the power drill.
Expend the hole on the small pot using a knife.
Insert a nut and a washer in one side of the threaded rod.
Hold the metal rod vertically up on a solid surface.
Insert the large flower pot upside down.
Insert a washer followed by a nut to tight up the pot.
Insert two nuts and a washer from the other side of the rod.
Insert the smaller flower pot followed by a washer.
Insert the base.
steps.description: This is where you will put the candles.

steps.headline: Insert a washer underneath the base.
Insert a nut.
steps.description: This nut allows the user to adjust the base if needed.

steps.headline: On top of the rod, insert the both ends of the chain then insert a nut to tight it up.
Place four candles on the base of the pot.

tyn: 1x 8” clay flower pot with a base
1x small power drill to make a hole on the base of the pot
text: Drill a 5/8” hole on the base of the flower pot using the power drill. Apply minimal force required. Expend the hole on the small pot using a knife.  Insert a nut and a washer in one side of the threaded rod. Twist it in about 1.5 inch. Hold the metal rod vertically up on a solid surface.  Insert the large flower pot upside down.  Insert a washer followed by a nut to tight up the pot.  Insert two nuts and a washer from the other side of the rod.  Insert the smaller flower pot followed by a washer.  Insert a nut. Make sure nothing is moving. Insert the base. This is where you will put the candles. Insert a washer underneath the base.  Insert a nut. This nut allows the user to adjust the base if needed. On top of the rod, insert the both ends of the chain then insert a nut to tight it up.  Place four candles on the base of the pot. If necessary adjust the base. Light up the candles carefully.
